javadoc: Navigation is only supported if the underlying table model implements ProgramTableModel and the setGoToService() method has been called with a valid reference. When both of these conditions are met, then the table will navigate on a user's double-click or on an Enter key press. Also, if selection navigation is enabled, then this table will navigate any time the selection of the table changes. To prevent this feature call {@link #setNavigateOnSelectionEnabled(boolean)} with a value of false.

methods.javadoc:
Installs the default {@link TableCellRenderer}s for known Ghidra table cell data classes.
 Subclasses can override this method to add additional types or to change the default
 associations.
methods.name: initDefaultRenderers
methods.comment:
Installs the default TableCellRenderers for known Ghidra table cell data classes.
 Subclasses can override this method to add additional types or to change the default
 associations.

methods.name: installNavigation
methods.comment: Sets the GoTo service to use when navigation is enabled on this table.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the program selection equivalent to the rows currently selected in the table. This method is only valid when the underlying table model implements {@link ProgramTableModel}.

Returns null if no rows are selected or the underlying model does not implement ProgramTableModel. @return the program selection or null.
methods.name: getProgramSelection
methods.comment:
Returns the program selection equivalent to the rows currently selected in the table. 
 This method is only valid when the underlying table model implements
 ProgramTableModel.
 
 Returns null if no rows are selected or
 the underlying model does not implement ProgramTableModel.

methods.name: getProgram
methods.comment:
Returns the program being used by this table; null if the underlying model does not
 implement ProgramTableModel

methods.javadoc:
Does nothing if no {@link GoToService} has been installed from 
 {@link #installNavigation(GoToService, Navigatable)}.  Also, this method will do 
 nothing if this table's <tt>TableModel</tt> is not an instance of {@link ProgramTableModel}.  
 Otherwise, this method will attempt to go to the program location denoted by the 
 given row and column.
@param row the row
@param column the column
methods.name: navigate
methods.comment:
Does nothing if no GoToService has been installed from 
 #installNavigation(GoToService, Navigatable).  Also, this method will do 
 nothing if this table's TableModel is not an instance of ProgramTableModel.  
 Otherwise, this method will attempt to go to the program location denoted by the 
 given row and column.

methods.javadoc:
Does nothing if no {@link GoToService} has been installed from {@link #installNavigation(GoToService, Navigatable)}. Otherwise, this method will attempt to go to the program location denoted by the given row and column.

This method differs from {@link #navigate(int, int)} in that this method will not navigate if {@link #navigateOnSelection} is false.
methods.name: navigateOnCurrentSelection
methods.comment:
Does nothing if no GoToService has been installed from 
 #installNavigation(GoToService, Navigatable).  Otherwise, this method will attempt 
 to go to the program location denoted by the given row and column.
 
 This method differs from #navigate(int, int) in that this method will not 
 navigate if #navigateOnSelection is false.

methods.name: setNavigateOnSelectionEnabled
methods.comment:
Allows the user to enable and disable the table's feature that triggers navigation on
 certain selection events, like mouse clicking and pressing the 'Enter' key.

params.name: enabled
params.comment: true enables the navigation on selection feature.

methods.javadoc:
Selects the given row and performs a goto, if applicable.
@param row The row to select
methods.name: selectRow
methods.comment: Selects the given row and performs a goto, if applicable.

name: GhidraTable
comment:
Navigation is only supported if the underlying table model
 implements ProgramTableModel and the setGoToService() method
 has been called with a valid reference.  When both of these conditions are met, then the 
 table will navigate on a user's double-click or on an Enter key press.  Also, if 
 selection navigation is enabled, then this table will navigate any time the selection of
 the table changes.  To prevent this feature call 
 #setNavigateOnSelectionEnabled(boolean) with a value of false.
